it is better to segregate non code licenses from now, 
for eg see here https://choosealicense.com/non-software/
put a note on contributing to this ZeroNet repo readme that non-code license will be treated differently

> Non-Software Licenses
Open source software licenses can be also used for non-software works and are often the best choice, especially when the works in question can be edited and versioned as source (e.g., open source hardware designs). Choose an open source license here.

>Data, media, etc.
CC0-1.0, CC-BY-4.0, and CC-BY-SA-4.0 are open licenses used for non-software material ranging from datasets to videos. Note that CC-BY-4.0 and CC-BY-SA-4.0 should not be used for software.

>Documentation
Any open source software license or open license for media (see above) also applies to software documentation. If you use different licenses for your software and its documentation, be sure to specify that source code examples in the documentation are also licensed under the software license.

>Fonts
The SIL Open Font License 1.1 keeps fonts open but allows them to be freely used in other works.

>Mixed Projects
If your project contains a mix of software and other material, you can include multiple licenses, as long as you are explicit about which license applies to each part of the project. See the license notice for this site as an example.

@imachug @HelloZeroNet 

>
## Contributing to this repo
This repo is governed by GPLv3, same is located at the root of the ZeroNet git repo, unless specified separately all code is governed by that license, contributions to this repo are divided into two key types, key contributions and non-key contributions, key contributions are which, directly affects the code performance, quality and features of software, non key contributions include things like translation datasets, image, graphic or video contributions that does not affect the main usability of software but improves the existing usability of certain thing or feature, these also include tests written with code, since their purpose is to check, whether something is working or not as intended. Unless specified above a contribution is ruled by the type of contribution if there is a conflict between two contributing parties of repo in any case.

For example follow this
For Example if have windows machine 
use this cmd to start zeronet
python zeronet.py "--data_dir "some-dir"
this will start zerenet
now go to http://127.0.0.1:43110/Config
in Trackers files section
provide your trackers file there eg : data/trackers.txt
 
this will give you an error 
> Error loading trackers file: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: './data/trackers.txt'

hope you get it.

@HelloZeroNet some platforms it will be easy to use, but on some like android
if you use public facing data dir you have to enter something like
> /storage/emulated/0/Android/data/in.canews.zeronet/files/data/trakers.txt

which is not convenient to user. 
instead if user use some thing like 
> data/trackers.txt
 we can simply assume data dir is zeronet data dir

also if user has more than 1 file to use, it will be more difficult 
> /storage/emulated/0/Android/data/in.canews.zeronet/files/data/trakers.txt
> /storage/emulated/0/Android/data/in.canews.zeronet/files/data/somefile.txt

if we allow data/ as valid path it will be reduced to

> data/trackers.txt

topic.title: Need an Option to Provide Custom OpenSSL binary
topic.body: I'm creating an Android client for ZeroNet, app is targeting Api 29, we cannot provide executable binary in app's home directory according to Android 10 (Api 29) Changes, app native dir is not static which changes on app reinstall so we need a configuration option for providing custom openssl binary position.

topic.title: Added Custom Openssl Path for Native Clients
Added Custom Openssl Path for Native Clients and Fixed Tracker files provided are not loading on some systems
Standardize and Publish ZeroNet Protocol Specifications.
topic.body: Since there is no documentation on ZeroNet Protocol Specifications, it is better to start standardize the low level specifications, so it's easy to implement on various other languages, see for example BitTorrent has various beps specific to features, I was considering ZeroNet as next(third) generation internet and moving with usages of this type of interest, I already drawn up problems faced by these type of systems and solutions for them on table. Also if these specifications are standardized, then we can implement this in lower level languages for performance benifits that improves the ZeroNet Network.

topic.title: Added Custom Openssl Path for Native Clients and start_dir config
Fixes Tracker Files not accessed when there is custom data dir
topic.body: If we have string form of data dir like "data/trackers.json" and custom data conf applied to zeronet, there is no condition in loop to catch it. this will cause zeronet defaults to last default option, which in return is not valid path.

topic.title: Site Data not downloading for new installation
topic.body:
### Step 1: Please describe your environment

  * ZeroNet version: 4452
  * Operating system: Windows / Android
  * Web browser: Edge latest
  * Tor status: available
  * Opened port: yes 

### Step 2: Describe the problem:
If you install zeronet with latest revision, site data is not downloading, but if we have site data, then sites are working as usual
#### Steps to reproduce:
update zeronet to latest rev

if it is fresh install open zerotalk

if you already have data folder rename to data-org as backup and restart zeronet
and open zerotalk

it shows Initial sync in progress...

after some time site showing as your own site.

#### Observed Results:
![Annotation 2020-02-21 172010](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26790557/75032379-7881f380-54ce-11ea-8b4a-d1283fc69eee.png)


#### Expected Results:
Should download site data.

> Your port xxxxx is closed, but your Tor gateway is running well.

topic.title: Added Github Action Test Badge to ReadMe
Need More Protocols for Frontend.
topic.body:
Currently ZeroNet Supports websocket and html  rendering, while on web these are sufficient, for native apps(apps which are not run on browsers), these are less efficient, suppose if you want to connect to site you need to render the site to get wrapper key and connect to websocket and get content from the site.
Instead I propose to add protocols like REST Api, which can also be used on browser side as well as native side. Further, unless you need real-time updates websocket is less efficient than REST API, since it need to persist connection between client and server.

topic.title: [ Feature Request ] File Proxies for Content Deduplication.
topic.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Currently, I had a PDF Doc(250 MB) with featured Graphics on drive and want to publish on ZeroNet, but I don't want two copies on my computer.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Solution I want to propose here is, we should have file proxies on sites with some extension, these should contain file location, file hash, file size etc meta data, when ZeroNet saw these it will retrieve meta data and send the proxy to peers and after receival proxy file, other side will check hash and ask the original file. so this way we don't have to maintain 2 copies of file, ZeroNet should also able check for file changes.

**Problems that will solved by these files**
 - Duplicate files across sites will be maintained at single place using this technique. This Partially Solves https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/2192
 - Files which are more than certain size will diverted to unified location and serve from there.

**Additional context**
We can also use Hash Section to add Other hashes like those used by torrent protocol or IPFS content address hashes etc, so plugins will handles non default hash types in the file.

topic.title: Openssl Lib Not Found Error.
Always revise rev number for Important Updates.
topic.body:
@imachug pushed the fix for openssl library search path, but due to non change of rev number bug still exists on repo, so for this type of fixes always change rev number before pushing changes.
@HelloZeroNet

  * Operating system: Android/ZeroNet Mobile
  * Web browser: any
  * Tor status: available
  * Opened port: no
  * Special configuration: canewsin app

### Step 2: Describe the problem:
There is bug in Text Editor, while posting something on sites like ZeroNet Talk, if I copy paste some text into it and go to line start and type enter on Android, it will delete some text, this happens all the time, if you are not able to reproduce it, press enter until you see it.
